hosting.connect.info:
Use the ATHP provided connection details to join your own server.
Most Hosters also generate Privilege Keys, which can be used to grant yourself Admin permissions on your server.

Enter the details you received and start chatting along!
hosting.connect.title: @:(hosting.find.title): Connect to your Server
hosting.find.description:
You can rent a TeamSpeak 3 server from one of our Authorized TeamSpeak Hosting Providers (ATHPs).

Choose the right hosting provider for you, by clicking the button below.

Visit the ATHPs website to order a TeamSpeak 3 Server and come back, when you received your connection details.
hosting.find.title: Find a Hoster
hosting.self_or_rent.info:
Setup your own private TeamSpeak Server by either hosting it yourself or by renting a server from one of our authorized hosters.

Do you have your own hardware on which you want to host your TeamSpeak server or do you want to use the servers of our partners?
hosting.server_software.connect.info:
Use your Server IP or Domain alongside your configured port to connect to your server.
On the first start, the server generates a Privilege Key which grants Admin permissions. You can directly use it below, or use it at a late point when connected to the server.
hosting.server_software.download.title: Host a TeamSpeak Server yourself
hosting.server_software.setup.help: If you need further assistance, you can visit the {helpPage}.
hosting.server_software.setup.intro: You can set up and configure your own TeamSpeak 3 server with absolutely no licensing costs (limited to 1 virtual server and 32 slots) by following these steps:
hosting.server_software.setup.step.1: Download the TS3 server software from {here} for your respective operating system.
hosting.server_software.setup.step.2: Extract the downloaded file and place the server folder on target location on your hard drive.
hosting.server_software.setup.step.3: Ensure that port 9987 UDP (our default port for Voice) is forwarded in your router.
hosting.server_software.setup.step.4: Execute the tsserver binary. This requires you to read & agree to the license agreement. For details see the 'accept_license_error' log file.

server.edit.flood_protection.block.ip: Points needed to Block IP Address
server.edit.flood_protection.block.ip.in: Set the amount of points a user needs to accumulate before their IP address gets temporarily blocked.
server.edit.flood_protection.info: Flood protection works by assigning points to every action a user can do on your server. Some actions have more points than others, and once a threshold for points is reached, the user is blocked temporarily from doing anything. Flood points are reduced for each user per tick (500 milliseconds), allowing actions to be taken again if the user is temporarily blocked.
server.edit.flood_protection.remove_per_: Set the amount of points reduced per tick.
server.edit.flood_protection.title: Flood Protection

server.edit.security.identity_level.info: The required security level determines how long users will have to improve the quality of their identity before it will be considered valid to connect to this server. settings.audio.broadcast.vad.desc.activi: automatically when voice activity is detected.
you press the Push to Talk button and voice activity is detected.

You decide on which of your TeamSpeak Servers you want to talk.

settings.audio.output_volume.desc: Reduce the overall playback volume of other peoples voices.
Add synthetic background noise to fill the artificial silence when no one is speaking.
settings.audio.processing.echo_reduction: Adjust your input signal to reduce echoes from your surroundings.

settings.audio.processing.gain.info: Automatically level the volume of other users.
settings.audio.processing.noise_reductio: Remove background noise from your microphone input signal.

settings.audio.processing.typing.info: Detect and reduce the sounds made by typing.
settings.audio.push_to_talk.info: Only enable your microphone while holding a button when you want to speak.
settings.audio.test.info: Record a sample of yourself speaking to test how your voice sounds to other users. You can make real-time changes whilst playing back your recording.

settings.audio.vad.disabled.info: Use hands-free communication and have your microphone enabled as you start speaking.
settings.audio.vad.mode.automatic.info: Uses intelligent algorithms to determine that your input signal contains speech.
settings.audio.vad.mode.hybrid.info: Uses a volume gate and intelligent algorithms to determine speech presence probability.
settings.audio.vad.mode.volume_gate.info: Uses a volume gate to start transmitting by speaking loud enough.

settings.chat.contacts.group_offline.dis: Offline contacts are shown in their actual contact category.

settings.chat.filter.moderation.enabled: Extra information like users joining and leaving a chat will be shown alongside chat messages.
settings.chat.history.disabled: Unread message notifications will be displayed right in your contact and group chats list.
settings.chat.history.enabled: All chats and unread message notifications will be displayed in a dedicated sidebar section.
settings.chat.ignored_users.empty.info: You can set other chat users as Ignored, meaning TeamSpeak will ignore any invites and messages from them

setup_chat.bookmarks.features: Depending on the configuration, you need to meet certain permission requirements in order to get access.
setup_chat.bookmarks.features.warning: Not every TeamSpeak Server offers Homebase functionality.
setup_chat.bookmarks.identity.custom: A custom identity is used for the connection.
setup_chat.bookmarks.identity.default: The default identity is used for the connection.
setup_chat.bookmarks.info:
The following Servers from your Bookmarks can serve as your Homebase.
Connect to the Server you want to pick and follow the Steps shown in the Notification right after.
setup_chat.bookmarks.title: Homebase from your bookmarks
setup_chat.complete.all_set: You are all set with your new Homebase
setup_chat.complete.contacts_are_added: Your contacts from your previous chat account are automatically added on your new Homebase.
setup_chat.complete.title: Homebase Setup Completed
setup_chat.intro.features: We offer exciting new chat features like {contacts} and {groupChats}.
setup_chat.intro.features.tooltips.chats: Expanding beyond the scope of TeamSpeak servers, you can now host direct and group chats as well! You can even have end-to-end encrypted direct chats for more security.
setup_chat.intro.features.tooltips.conta: Stay in touch with your friends, add them to your global contact list.
setup_chat.intro.features.tooltips.files: Offering a new system for file transfers, add attachments directly to chat messages.
setup_chat.intro.features.tooltips.group: Create public and private group chats, send out invitations and stay in touch with your community.
setup_chat.intro.get_started: To get started, you need to set up your Homebase. It's the place that hosts all your voice sessions, chats and data.
setup_chat.intro.homebase.from_bookmarks: Pick one of your favorite Servers as the place for your Homebase.
setup_chat.intro.homebase.from_public.in: Checkout public available Homebase Servers from our Community.
setup_chat.intro.homebase.info: Homebases are part of the TeamSpeak Server {disclosure} so basically any TeamSpeak Community can act as your Homebase when you get access from an admin or you pick a public server with available slots.
setup_chat.intro.homebase.info.tooltip: Servers with version 5.0 and up, with activated decentral chat feature.
setup_chat.intro.homebase.self_host.subt: You can indeed! You can host your own Homebase by renting out a TS5 Server from one of our official hosting partners.
setup_chat.intro.homebase.self_host.titl: Can I host my own Homebase?
setup_chat.intro.homebase.use_myts: We can also host your Homebase!
setup_chat.intro.homebase.use_myts.limit: However by choosing myTeamSpeak as your Homebase, some limitations apply.
setup_chat.intro.title: Welcome to the Homebase Setup
setup_chat.myts.host_on_myts: Host your Homebase with our {myts} service.
setup_chat.myts.limits: However by choosing this route for your Homebase, the following limitations apply:
setup_chat.myts.limits.persistent_storag: Attachments will be deleted after 30 days
setup_chat.myts.title: Select myTS as your Homebase
setup_chat.public.info: These are available options from our Server List. You can check them out and decide afterwards if they are a good option for your Homebase.
setup_chat.public.title: Public available Homebases
setup_chat.public.view_discovery: You can also use our full Server Discovery to find a matching Homebase for your chat experience.
setup_chat.title: Setup Chat

spaces.info: Spaces will allow you to create shareable groups of contacts, chats and servers.
terms_and_conditions.title: Terms and Conditions
toolbar.toggle.quick.tooltip:
Click: all
{alt_key_name}+Click: current
SHIFT+Click: other except current
tour.main_window.activity.text: This area of the sidebar will give you an overview of your current client activities and also allow you to pin contacts and group chats with a simple double click.
tour.main_window.activity.text.slim: This will give you an overview of your current client activities and also allow you to pin contacts and group chats with a simple double click.
tour.main_window.activity.title: Activity Area
tour.main_window.bookmarks.text: Bookmark and connect to your favorite voice servers, add your friends and colleagues, join group chats and discover thousands of communities.
tour.main_window.bookmarks.title: Your TeamSpeak
tour.main_window.dashboard.text: Clicking on this button will open the dashboard where you can explore Servers & Chats and quickly join them.
tour.main_window.dashboard.title: Dashboard Button
tour.main_window.notifications.text: Every time you receive a friend request, a group chat invite, a poke, a new client update, or get mentioned in a chat, the bell will let you know.
tour.main_window.notifications.title: Notification Bell
tour.main_window.presence.text: Once the Chat Setup is finished, you can simply change your chat status to away, do not disturb or even invisible. Display a global chat status that will be shown to all of your contacts. An easy way to let your friends know what you're currently up to or how you feel.
tour.main_window.presence.text.slim: Once the Chat Setup is finished, you can simply change your chat status to away, do not disturb or even invisible. Display a global chat status that will be shown to all of your contacts.
tour.main_window.presence.title: Presence Menu
tour.main_window.search.text: You can quickly and simply connect to servers, find friends, join group chats and access all options we provide in the settings by simply searching for them.
tour.main_window.search.title: Smart Search
tour.main_window.settings.text: By clicking on the settings icon, you can manage, customize and personalize the look and feel of your TeamSpeak client and explore what it has to offer.
tour.main_window.settings.title: Settings Button
tour.main_window.welcome.text: Welcome to the all new TeamSpeak Client! If you're unfamiliar with the client, we recommend you to use this small tour of our dashboard.
tour.main_window.welcome.title: TeamSpeak Tour
universal.author: Author
universal.folder.create.title: New Folder
universal.name: Name
url.external.non_official_url_below_warn: Notice: The URL below is not an official TeamSpeak site. Do you want to continue to this site?
